revised_title: Researches on the Hydrocarbons of the Series CnH2n+2: Hexyl-Hydride Derivatives
tldr: The author investigates the derivatives of hexyl-hydride, a hydrocarbon from petroleum, and discovers new chemical reactions and compounds formed through the interaction with chlorine. The study includes the formation of hexyl-chloride, hexylene, and hexyl-acetate, as well as the oxidation of alcohols and the identification of a secondary hexyl-alcohol.
